question: Which three are true about the HttpServletRequestWrapper class? (Choose three.)

options.A: The HttpServletRequestWrapper is an example of the Decorator pattern.
options.C: A subclass of HttpServletRequestWrapper CANNOT modify the behavior of the getReader method.
options.B: The HttpServletRequestWrapper can be used to extend the functionality of a servlet request.
options.E: An HttpServletRequestWrapper CANNOT be used on the request passed to the RequestDispatcher.interface.
options.D: An HttpServletRequestWrapper may be used only by a class implement the javax.servlet.Filter interface.
options.F: An HttpServletRequestWrapper may modify the header of a request within an object implementing the javax.servlet.Filter interface.
